abstract: The National Security Agency sought to enlist Qwest in a domestic surveillance program in February 2001, according to the company’s former chief executive.
snippet: The National Security Agency sought to enlist Qwest in a domestic surveillance program in February 2001, according to the company’s former chief executive.
lead_paragraph: The phone company Qwest Communications refused a proposal from the National Security Agency that the company’s lawyers considered illegal in February 2001, nearly seven months before the terrorist attacks on Sept. 11, the former head of the company contends in newly unsealed court filings.

headline.main: Former Phone Chief Says Spy Agency Sought Surveillance Help Before 9/11
headline.print_headline: Former Phone Chief Says Spy Agency Sought Surveillance Help Before 9/11

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
